column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
There was a lot of furniture in the room.

The room was full {{c1::of}} furniture.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
I don't like sport very much.

I'm not very keen {{c1::on}} sport.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
I'm not a very good tennis player.

I'm not very good {{c1::at}} tennis.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
We don't have enough time.

We're short {{c1::of}} time.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
Steven's wife is a doctor.

Steven is married {{c1::to}} a doctor.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
Nobody wants to buy my car.

Nobody is interested {{c1::in}} buying my car.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
These days everyone knows about the dangers of smoking.

These days everyone is aware {{c1::of}} the dangers of smoking.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition.
column3:
My problem is not the same as yours.

My problem is different {{c1::from|to|than}} yours.
